section.title: Reading Assignment
section.p: Read Section 11.4 of Applied Discrete Structures. The definitions of modular addition and multiplication in this section are really important. They are used throughout the rest of the book. The section starts with a review of division properties for integers in order to set up the modular operations. Generally, the mod n operations are operations only on either \mathbb{Z}_n, or a subset of \mathbb{Z}_n. For example, it wouldn't make sense to do mod 10 addition on Z_{12}.

statement.p: If the product of two numbers is zero, must one of the numbers equal zero?

section.p: Also, turn in solutions to the following exercises. Both of them could be done using SageMath by typing two short inputs, but you are encouraged to write (or type) both of these be hand.

statement.p: Compute the greatest common divisor of 2028 and 1001.
Write out the operation table for mod 4 addition on \mathbb{Z}_4. Identify the inverse of each element.
Determine the additive and multiplicative inverses of 99 mod 1001
Write out the operation table for mod 8 multiplication on \mathbb{U}_8= \{k \in \mathbb{Z}_8 \mid \gcd{(8,k)}=1\}. Identify the inverse of each element.
Write out the operation table for mod 10 multiplication on T=\{0,2,4,6,8\}. Is [T;\times_{10}] a monoid? Is it a group?
